str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and the middle voice of bouleuo; to misconsult, i.e. Disregard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pleroo; to complete; by implication, to occupy, supply; figuratively, to accomplish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From hustereo; a deficit; specially, poverty.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From leitourgeo; public function ('liturgy') or almsgiver).
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
